p: Intramedullary intervertebral disc extrusion (IMDE) and acute noncompressive nucleus pulposus extrusion (ANNPE) have both been described as causes of acute spinal cord dysfunction in dogs, with distinct magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) findings. The aims of this study were to compare the clinical signs and short‚Äêterm outcome of dogs diagnosed with presumptive IMDE to dogs with presumptive ANNPE.
